commit_message:
remove null_safe_int from module scope

The null_safe_int implementation is not a fortunate one as it returns
empty string when called with None. This can be dangerous as it is not
a int. However there is no generic good value to return so this cannot
be really fixed.

Currently the null_safe_int is only used to convert the progress field
of the Instance object into the legacy instance notifications. This patch
proposes no to break that legacy behavior but also discurage the usage
of this convesion in general by removing null_safe_int from the module
scope and inlining to the the only place it is used.

Change-Id: I58b1c128c27d5ae7922eead95f808ea77b3fcd06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/455778/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def null_safe_str(s): return str(s) if s else '' def null_safe_int(s): return int(s) if s is not None else 0 def null_safe_isotime(s): if isinstance(s, datetime.datetime): return strtime(s) else: return str(s) if s else ''

commit_message:
Set HOME when doing sudo pip install by using 'sudo -H'

Set the HOME variable correctly by doing 'sudo -H' when doing the pip
install.

If this is not done, then pip will display a warning message and not
use the cache directory.

Change-Id: I2a54bf4ab02d6c7cb7aaba1dd261427ee814625f

commit_message:
WIP/DNM: Playing with logfile names

**** This change would require changes to callers of grenade ensure_logs_exist ****

**** This change would require changes to elastic-recheck ***

Make the screen-* logfile names longer. This will help newcomers as
the filename will make it clearer on what the purpose of the file is.

Change-Id: I7ad650af523033230212eb9fc247baae4bbbe7cc

commit_message:
Use longer names for screen- log files

Change the screen- log file names to:
    screen-ironic-api.*
    screen-ironic-conductor.*

Rather than: screen-ir-api.* & screen-ir-cond.*

This will help newcomers more easily figure out which logfile is for
ironic.

Change-Id: Idf38d531fd2b5d1f268ee26c18bba8fc89d1f809

commit_message:
run_process: Add ability to specify a longer log name

Add the ability to specify a longer logfile name when processes are
not run with screen.

This will allow the ability to specify a more descriptive logfile
names in the gate to help newcomers to OpenStack more easily know what
the logfiles are when reading the filenames.

This will have no impact when running in a devstack environment using
screen. Thus the short names will still be used for the screen tabs.

Change-Id: I5f51a36c50191a8c6dcad2c7a80a022f19be58e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/20/438120/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Specify a longer name to be used when naming the logfile when not running # under screen local longname=$5 _run_process "${longname:-$name}" "$command" "$group" &

subject: Add call_func_until_true() function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 23:29:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/cbbccd4fb34e539aeb239a888eff89659e081079', 'message': 'Have call_until_true() return the result from the called func

Instead of only returning True when the called function returns a
true-ish value, return the result from the called function.

If the called function never returns a true-ish value, then still return

commit_message:
Add call_func_until_true() function

Add a new 'call_func_until_true()' function. 'call_func_until_true()'
will call a function until it returns a "true-ish" value and return that
value. If the called function never returns a "true-ish" value before
the timeout expires it will return False.

Update 'call_until_true()' to use 'call_func_until_true()'

Change-Id: Ib96caba70e22967adf1048c96a7bcc2572716f91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/40/445240/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('time.sleep') @mock.patch('time.time') def test_call_until_true_when_f_returns_result(self, m_time, m_sleep): timeout = 42 # The value doesn't matter as we mock time.time() sleep = 60 # The value doesn't matter as we mock time.sleep() m_time.return_value = 0 self.assertEqual( 49, test_utils.call_until_true(lambda: 49, timeout, sleep) ) self.assertEqual(0, m_sleep.call_count) self.assertEqual(1, m_time.call_count)

added_lines: self._guest_add_pci_devices(guest, instance) def _guest_add_pci_devices(self, guest, instance): virt_type = guest.virt_type if virt_type not in ('xen', 'qemu', 'kvm'): # PCI devices is only supported for hypervisors # 'xen', 'qemu' and 'kvm'. if pci_manager.get_instance_pci_devs(instance, 'all'): raise exception.PciDeviceUnsupportedHypervisor(type=virt_type) # Get all generic PCI devices (non-SR-IOV). for pci_dev in pci_manager.get_instance_pci_devs(instance): guest.add_device(self._get_guest_pci_device(pci_dev))
deleted_lines: if virt_type in ('xen', 'qemu', 'kvm'): # Get all generic PCI devices (non-SR-IOV). for pci_dev in pci_manager.get_instance_pci_devs(instance): guest.add_device(self._get_guest_pci_device(pci_dev)) else: # PCI devices is only supported for hypervisor 'xen', 'qemu' and # 'kvm'. pci_devs = pci_manager.get_instance_pci_devs(instance, 'all') if len(pci_devs) > 0: raise exception.PciDeviceUnsupportedHypervisor( type=virt_type)

commit_message:
Remove step_9 tutorial from rally doc

The devstack deployer plugin was removed, however, the documentation
has not been updated. Let's update the documentation and remove that
tutorial.

Change-Id: Ideef4b2b70e182d9fa396fea6f00df0fa8cc4343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/32/475932/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. Copyright 2015 Mirantis Inc. All Rights Reserved. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. .. _tutorial_step_9_deploying_openstack: Step 9. Deploying OpenStack from Rally ====================================== Along with supporting already existing OpenStack deployments, Rally itself can **deploy OpenStack automatically** by using one of its *deployment engines*. Take a look at other `deployment configuration file samples`_. For example, *devstack-in-existing-servers.json* is a deployment configuration file that tells Rally to deploy OpenStack with **Devstack** on the existing servers with given credentials: .. code-block:: json { "type": "DevstackEngine", "provider": { "type": "ExistingServers", "credentials": [{"user": "root", "host": "10.2.0.8"}] } } You can try to deploy OpenStack in your Virtual Machine using this script. Edit the configuration file with your IP address/user name and run, as usual: .. code-block:: console $ rally deployment create --file=samples/deployments/for_deploying_openstack_with_rally/devstack-in-existing-servers.json --name=new-devstack +---------------------------+----------------------------+--------------+------------------+ | uuid | created_at | name | status | +---------------------------+----------------------------+--------------+------------------+ | <Deployment UUID> | 2015-01-10 22:00:28.270941 | new-devstack | deploy->finished | +---------------------------+----------------------------+--------------+------------------+ Using deployment : <Deployment UUID> .. references: .. _deployment configuration file samples: https://github.com/openstack/rally/tree/master/samples/deployments

commit_message:
Don't fail hard on 404 from neutron FIP listing

We do a filtered FIP listing from _delete_servers, which has exposed our
list_floating_ips method as dying hard when it can't find a match.
That's pretty inconsistent with the rest of the API - return a [] in
that case but keep logging the big error message. The user should really
mark the cloud has floating_ip_source: None if they want the error
message to go away - which is indicated in the error message.

Change-Id: I76493e7cc004831c1a0620de9fbe004fdbc39e45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/08/475908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

If this is not the " " behavior you are looking for, set" " floating_ip_source: 'nova' or None in your" " clouds.yaml entry for cloud: %s", self.name # We can't fallback to nova because we push-down filters. # We got a 404 which means neutron doesn't exist. commit_message:
Fixed project lists for retrieving tempest plugins

As openstack/deb-, -specs and -ui project namespaces do not contain
tempest plugins. So, it is better to remove the above projects from
the list in which tempest plugin is searched.

Change-Id: Ie490073ea195a462cb7be0b88b6cb1b8a7b324b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/74/473774/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Retrieve projects having no deb, ui or spec namespace as those namespaces # does not contains tempest plugins. projects_list = [i for i in projects if not (i.startswith('openstack/deb-') or i.endswith('-ui') or i.endswith('-specs'))] found_plugins = filter(has_tempest_plugin, projects_list)

commit_message:
Fix using targeted cell context when finding services in cells

This fixes a place where we weren't using the yielded cell context,
which was causing us to check the same DB twice, and obviously hit
the ServiceNotUnique check when we shouldn't.

Change-Id: I95b06a8bbf8dcc600ffd83d7461ee367247c4782
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/475830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with nova_context.target_cell(context, cell) as cctxt: cell_service = lookup_fn(cctxt)

commit_message:
Migrate tools/ from OS-H to OS-H-Addons

This patch set migrates the toolset from OpenStack-Helm to
OpenStack-Helm-Addons in preparation to set up the necessary gate.
Future patch sets will refine this.

Change-Id: If0f1eeb5d871e47e245141f271a3487d9241cfba
Co-Authored-By: Steve Wilkerson <wilkers.steve@gmail.com>

subject: Add backlogged spec for etcd support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-08 19:22:14.000000000', 'files': ['specs/keystone/backlog/fernet-etcd.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs/commit/98a08cb259a5ec49b44fd4b055833d4e2849584a', 'message': 'Add backlogged spec for etcd support

bp fernet-etcd

Change-Id: I8df9b6369c994c46602b3efc049b8d2a9df942db
'}]
commit_message:
Add backlogged spec for etcd support

bp fernet-etcd

Change-Id: I8df9b6369c994c46602b3efc049b8d2a9df942db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/85/472385/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Fernet Compatibility with etcd ============================== `bp fernet-etcd <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/fernet-etcd>`_ Currently, keys used to encrypt and decrypt Fernet tokens are stored on disk. For security purposes, it is recommended that these keys are rotated. For operators, this means performing the rotation and pushing the new key repository state to all keystone nodes in multi-node deployments. With the OpenStack community `adopting etcd <http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-June/117967.html>`_ as a base service, we can leverage the benefits of a distributed key-value store. This will improve operator experience by making it easier for operators to perform key rotations in their deployment. Problem Description =================== The Fernet token provider requires keys to encrypt and decrypt tokens. The initial implementation introduced in Kilo persisted these keys to disk. In order for tokens to be valid across an entire deployment, these keys need to be in sync across all keystone nodes. The `keystone-manage` CLI tool as built-in commands to help with key management, but it's still up to operators to distribute keys and ensure they are properly synchronized. This is one downside to migrating to the Fernet token provider because it requires increased operator involvement. Proposed Change =============== With etcd, it is possible mitigate the need to synchronize keys across a deployment. This would require the Fernet backend to be pluggable, so that operators could opt into using etcd or continue using the file-based approach to key management. This would result in a backend implementation for the current file-based storage mechanism and a new implementation for etcd. The Fernet token provider would only need to call the interface to get keys for encryption and decryption. The implementation should ensure the `keystone-manage fernet_setup` and `keystone-manage fernet_rotate` commands work with both approaches. The Fernet token provider should also rely on a backend interface to get keys. An advantage of this approach is that key distribution would be handled automatically by etcd in the key rotation process. Operators would no longer be required to sync keys across the deployment after a rotation has taken place. Alternatives ------------ We make the Fernet backend pluggable but continue to research different backends for Fernet keys (e.g. Barbican or Castellan). Security Impact --------------- The security impact of this change requires moving sensitive data from keystone nodes to an external service. The access and security of etcd should be thoroughly examined and controlled. The current Fernet implementation limits recommends limited access to the `/etc/keystone/fernet-keys` directory. This same practice should be recommended for deployments wishing to use etcd for Fernet key storage. Notifications Impact -------------------- None. Other End User Impact --------------------- End users shouldn't be impacted by this feature. This feature is solely for the benefit of operators managing a keystone deployment. Performance Impact ------------------ Each token creation and validation request requires keystone to fetch a key from disk to perform encryption or decryption of a token. With this proposal, keystone will instead have to fetch key values from etcd instead. Once a proof-of-concept is done, benchmarks should be done with both approaches to understand the performance impacts of relying on etcd, if any. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- This change would require new configuration options. The operator would be expected to specify which key backend they wish to use in the deployment. If etcd is in use, keystone will need to know where that endpoint is so that it can POST and GET key values. This option would also require operators to setup a specific etcd service for keystone to use. This would be an upfront cost that must be done before keystone can start issuing Fernet tokens. Since Fernet keys classify as very sensitive information, it should be recommended that an isolated etcd deployment be maintained to manage them. Access to this deployment should be restricted to only keystone nodes and administrators. The trade-off of the new proposal is less synchronization of keys but requires more setup upfront in order for keystone to rely on keys being in etcd. Developer Impact ---------------- Developer maintaining or developing this will have to be familiar with etcd and how to deploy it. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: None Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Make the Fernet backend pluggable and adhere to an interface * Introduce a new `keystone.conf [fernet_tokens] fernet_backend` configuration option that defaults to the file-based implementation * Expose a new `keystone.conf [fernet_tokens] etcd_backends` configuration option to expose the etcd endpoint to the etcd backend driver * Introduce a new Fernet backend for etcd support * Ensure `keystone-manage fernet_setup` and `keystone-manage fernet_rotate` support setup and rotation of keys using etcd * Write documentation that clearly explains the operator benefits and drawbacks of both approaches Dependencies ============ None. Documentation Impact ==================== The administrator guide will have to be amended to include setup and management setup steps for deploying etcd. Documentation for configuring keystone to use etcd will also be required. References ========== `etcd documentation <https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/dev-guide/api_reference_v3.html>`_

Long story short my manual test case was not representative of all actual

For large clouds by the time we get to the timeout while loop at least

commit_message:
Fix introspection with retries edge case

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/403677/ finally landed and started
running in my jobs and builds started failing spuriously.

Long story short my manual test case was not representative of all actual
use cases.

For large clouds by the time we get to the timeout while loop at least
one node has always already finished introspection and the script works
as advertised. For smaller clouds (like my 3 node CI clouds which don't
really need this script very badly) this is not the case and the script
will fail.

To solve this problem I now explicitly wait for at least one node to be
on and in manageable state before going into the timeout and remove the
on != node count check entierly.

tl;dr test code that needs to run on 50 node clouds and 2 node clouds on
both. Yes I did that this time

Change-Id: Ie0f28567ec5713241d2ca0ed0ed2598d6d769b44

If device doesn't exit, TC doesn't need to raise an exception
during the deletion of the qdisc.

In iproute2 source code [1], the error code used is "1".

commit_message:
TC doesn't rise exception if device doesn't exist

If device doesn't exit, TC doesn't need to raise an exception
during the deletion of the qdisc.

In iproute2 source code [1], the error code used is "1".

[1] https://kernel.googlesource.com/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/shemminger/iproute2/+/master/tc/tc_qdisc.c#188

Change-Id: I9abecd6ef9d74abff27fb0ed0f5f4535c0622fd6

commit_message:
python3: use binary mode to open file in test

With text mode, trying to write a binary string generates a TypeError in
python 3

subject: Only search for floating ips if the server has them
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-20 19:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/45e689942676f52f5a405262b41c0d60a0d681ab', 'message': 'Only search for floating ips if the server has them

We have a server dict, which has an addresses dict. If the addresses
dict does not list any floating ips, then there is no need to spend the
API call to look for the fip ids needed to do the delete.

Change-Id: Iaf7583fe29bd197a59ae2728fd52d8de2ac1d411
'}]
commit_message:
Only search for floating ips if the server has them

We have a server dict, which has an addresses dict. If the addresses
dict does not list any floating ips, then there is no need to spend the
API call to look for the fip ids needed to do the delete.

Change-Id: Iaf7583fe29bd197a59ae2728fd52d8de2ac1d411
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/09/475909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _delete_server_floating_ips(self, server, delete_ip_retry): # Does the server have floating ips in its # addresses dict? If not, skip this. server_floats = meta.find_nova_interfaces( server['addresses'], ext_tag='floating') if not server_floats: return ips = self.search_floating_ips(filters={ 'device_id': server['id']}) for ip in ips: deleted = self.delete_floating_ip( ip['id'], retry=delete_ip_retry) if not deleted: raise OpenStackCloudException( "Tried to delete floating ip {floating_ip}" " associated with server {id} but there was" " an error deleting it. Not deleting server.".format( floating_ip=ip['floating_ip_address'], id=server['id'])) self._delete_server_floating_ips(server, delete_ip_retry)
deleted_lines: # TODO(mordred) Does the server have floating ips in its # addresses dict? If not, skip this. ips = self.search_floating_ips(filters={ 'device_id': server['id']}) for ip in ips: deleted = self.delete_floating_ip( ip['id'], retry=delete_ip_retry) if not deleted: raise OpenStackCloudException( "Tried to delete floating ip {floating_ip}" " associated with server {id} but there was" " an error deleting it. Not deleting server.".format( floating_ip=floating_ip, id=server['id']))

commit_message:
Add required config-file to container upload

The default is no config-file which results in the documented container
images upload command doing nothing. This is confusing for anyone
following the documentation.

Change-Id: Ie7d413835d50bcf3896301735ce402964b283bce
Related-Bug: #1699158
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/98/475898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack overcloud container image upload --config-file /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-common/container-images/overcloud_containers.yaml

commit_message:
[placement] Update placement devref to modern features

Adjust placement.rst so that it mentions traits and links to more
specs (rather than pending reviews).

Change-Id: Ic4e3ed8ddf9b2b4eb91c56d53ec72335ad3919c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/469047/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Each resource provider may also have a set of traits which describe qualitative aspects of the resource provider. Traits describe an aspect of a resource provider that cannot itself be consumed but a workload may wish to specify. For example, available disk may be solid state drivers (SSD). The following specifications represent the stages of design and development of resource providers and the Placement service. Implementation details may have changed or be partially complete at this time.* `Nested Resource Providers <http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/pike/approved/nested-resource-providers.html>`_ * `Custom Resource Classes <http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/custom-resource-classes.html>`_ * `Scheduler Filters in DB <http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters.html>`_ * `Scheduler claiming resources to the Placement API <http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/pike/approved/placement-claims.html>`_ * `The Traits API - Manage Traits with ResourceProvider <http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/pike/approved/resource-provider-traits.html>`_
deleted_lines: The following specifications are based on Newton work and while they present the idea or overview for the design, implementation details may have changed or be partially complete at this time. The following specifications are based on Ocata work and are subject to change. * `Nested Resource Providers <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386710/>`_ * `Custom Resource Classes <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/312696/>`_ * `Scheduler Filters in DB <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/300178/>`_

subject: Use ipv6 resolvers only with ipv6 networking
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-20 20:06:12.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/configure_mirror.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/023f9f19ac7d946e95b270c6d709f365b04ad555', 'message': "Use ipv6 resolvers only with ipv6 networking

If we have ipv6 networking that is routable then only use ipv6 name
resolvers to avoid traversing potential NAT with ipv4. If we don't have
ipv6 available and routable then only use ipv4 resolvers to avoid
timeouts and failovers.

Change-Id: I885418e07265002b09592c3cf3aff9712c6e001f
"}]
commit_message:
Use ipv6 resolvers only with ipv6 networking

If we have ipv6 networking that is routable then only use ipv6 name
resolvers to avoid traversing potential NAT with ipv4. If we don't have
ipv6 available and routable then only use ipv4 resolvers to avoid
timeouts and failovers.

Change-Id: I885418e07265002b09592c3cf3aff9712c6e001f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/10/475910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use only ipv6 resolvers if ipv6 is present and routable. This # avoids traversing potential NAT when using ipv4 which can be unreliable. # # Similarly do not use ipv6 resolvers if there is no ipv6 available as this # causes timeouts and failovers that are unnecesary. export NODEPOOL_STATIC_NAMESERVER_V6='2620:0:ccc::2' export NODEPOOL_STATIC_NAMESERVER_V4='208.67.222.222' export NODEPOOL_STATIC_NAMESERVER_V6_FALLBACK='2001:4860:4860::8888' export NODEPOOL_STATIC_NAMESERVER_V4_FALLBACK='8.8.8.8' if ip -6 route | grep '^default' ; then cat > /etc/unbound/forwarding.conf << EOF forward-zone: name: "." forward-addr: $NODEPOOL_STATIC_NAMESERVER_V6 forward-addr: $NODEPOOL_STATIC_NAMESERVER_V6_FALLBACK EOF else cat > /etc/unbound/forwarding.conf << EOF forward-zone: name: "." forward-addr: $NODEPOOL_STATIC_NAMESERVER_V4 forward-addr: $NODEPOOL_STATIC_NAMESERVER_V4_FALLBACK EOF fi if type -p systemctl ; then sudo systemctl restart unbound else sudo service unbound restart fi

commit_message:
Count floating ips to check quota

This changes floating ips from a ReservableResource to a
CountableResource and replaces quota reserve/commit/rollback with
check_deltas accordingly. Note that floating ip quota is only
relevant to nova-network and will be obsolete when nova-network is
removed.

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: I9e6c16ebe73f2af11bcc47899f25289f08c1204a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/457862/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: objects.Quotas.check_deltas(context, 'floating_ips', {'floating_ips': 1}, project_id) floating_ip = objects.FloatingIP.allocate_address( context, project_id, pool, auto_assigned=auto_assigned) # NOTE(melwitt): We recheck the quota after allocating the # object to handle races. The object will be deallocated if # we're over quota after object allocation. try: if use_quota: objects.Quotas.check_deltas(context, 'floating_ips', {'floating_ips': 0}, project_id) except exception.OverQuota: objects.FloatingIP.deallocate(context, floating_ip.address) LOG.warning(_LW("Quota exceeded for %s, tried to allocate " "floating IP"), context.project_id) raise exception.FloatingIpLimitExceeded() payload = dict(project_id=project_id, floating_ip=floating_ip) self.notifier.info(context, 'network.floating_ip.allocate', payload) objects.FloatingIP.deallocate(context, address)
deleted_lines: from nova import quotaQUOTAS = quota.QUOTAS reservations = QUOTAS.reserve(context, floating_ips=1, project_id=project_id) try: floating_ip = objects.FloatingIP.allocate_address( context, project_id, pool, auto_assigned=auto_assigned) payload = dict(project_id=project_id, floating_ip=floating_ip) self.notifier.info(context, 'network.floating_ip.allocate', payload) # Commit the reservations if use_quota: QUOTAS.commit(context, reservations, project_id=project_id) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): if use_quota: QUOTAS.rollback(context, reservations, project_id=project_id) use_quota = not floating_ip.auto_assigned project_id = floating_ip.project_id # Get reservations... try: if use_quota: reservations = QUOTAS.reserve(context, project_id=project_id, floating_ips=-1) else: reservations = None except Exception: reservations = None LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to update usages deallocating " "floating IP")) rows_updated = objects.FloatingIP.deallocate(context, address) # number of updated rows will be 0 if concurrently another # API call has also deallocated the same floating ip if not rows_updated: if reservations: QUOTAS.rollback(context, reservations, project_id=project_id) else: # Commit the reservations if reservations: QUOTAS.commit(context, reservations, project_id=project_id)

commit_message:
Write action to get private key from the validations keypair

Currently there's only the action to get the public key, however
it's useful to get the private key as well. For instance, in cases
where we're using an ansible playbook. This way, we can use the
existing utilities to copy the public keys to the nodes, and then
use the private key for running ansible.

Change-Id: Ia44651d3d5908fa7ecd7e7ea2e288f4fe9faa7cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/64/475664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove volume_group_vios_name

nova-powervm commit c64087adb003925d33f1bd75c7119f4c0f83afd6
removed the only code using CONF.localdisk.volume_group_vios_name
but neglected to remove the conf definition itself or the
references in devref. This change removes both since they no
longer apply.

Change-Id: I2bd2739c99d7fd12f9a111dec62286f04e345e6b

commit_message:
Add policy sample generation

This adds the entry point and config file necessary for using the
oslo.policy sample generation script. It also adds a tox target to
simplify the usage of it. Finally, this commit adds
murano.common.policies.base.list_rules to
murano.common.polices (__init__.py) so that the base rules are
also included in the generated policy file.

Note that the policy sample is generated as a YAML which is
the standard adopted by Nova [0] and Keystone [1] and is now
the standard across OpenStack since Ocata [2]:

    While the old json format policy file is still supported,
    we recommend using the newer YAML format file, more intuitive
    syntax.

The output from tox -egenpolicy will be:

    murano.policy.sample.yaml in murano/etc.

The policy documentation was already updated in
I1a8581a559e4333a74d56a5bdce7e6d1f117907d

[0] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e845d66a1baeacaf7cbb3f5cd3fc3e75961ec372/etc/nova/nova-policy-generator.conf
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/config-generator/keystone-policy-generator.conf
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/policy-yaml-file.html#older-json-format-policy

Change-Id: I2356ac0b2033bd83caaf2672189670fc300e55fd
Partially-Implements: blueprint policy-in-code

commit_message:
Bump plugins SHA to HEAD

The plugins repo has a bunch of connection plugin fixes which
repair functionality so containers can be connected to by ansible
properly.

We should get these fixes pulled into the integrated repo asap.

Change-Id: I0692cbcf932d428227aed8d7df42dfbdcf3281f2

commit_message:
Add maxconn parameter to MySQL / HAProxy

Allows configurability of maxconn as applies to
the MySQL section of the HAProxy config, both
for clustercheck and single node.

Also adds a new test for the haproxy class
overall to exercise options.

Change-Id: I023682dd5e85cc78d6dd3e5214a53863acc4f303

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1], 3.4[2] and 3.5[3]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html
[3]: https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: Idbc23bd07ab07f137cac1c5c5090e4276582bf16

commit_message:
placement: separate normalize_resources_qs_param

Move the _normalize_resources_qs_param() method from the resource_provider
handler into the util module so the followup patch adding an
allocation_candidate handler can use it.

Change-Id: Id4d8a314a0a8aa166387fc5e0768d835873f3e3e
blueprint: placement-allocation-requests
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/99/475599/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resources = util.normalize_resources_qs_param(req.GET['resources'])
deleted_lines: def _normalize_resources_qs_param(qs): """Given a query string parameter for resources, validate it meets the expected format and return a dict of amounts, keyed by resource class name. The expected format of the resources parameter looks like so: $RESOURCE_CLASS_NAME:$AMOUNT,$RESOURCE_CLASS_NAME:$AMOUNT So, if the user was looking for resource providers that had room for an instance that will consume 2 vCPUs, 1024 MB of RAM and 50GB of disk space, they would use the following query string: ?resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:1024,DISK_GB:50 The returned value would be: { "VCPU": 2, "MEMORY_MB": 1024, "DISK_GB": 50, } :param qs: The value of the 'resources' query string parameter :raises `webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest` if the parameter's value isn't in the expected format. """ result = {} resource_tuples = qs.split(',') for rt in resource_tuples: try: rc_name, amount = rt.split(':') except ValueError: msg = _('Badly formed resources parameter. Expected resources ' 'query string parameter in form: ' '?resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:1024. Got: %s.') msg = msg % rt raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) try: amount = int(amount) except ValueError: msg = _('Requested resource %(resource_name)s expected positive ' 'integer amount. Got: %(amount)s.') msg = msg % { 'resource_name': rc_name, 'amount': amount, } raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) if amount < 1: msg = _('Requested resource %(resource_name)s requires ' 'amount >= 1. Got: %(amount)d.') msg = msg % { 'resource_name': rc_name, 'amount': amount, } raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) result[rc_name] = amount return result resources = _normalize_resources_qs_param(req.GET['resources'])

commit_message:
Remove explicit global_request_id from keystoneauth subclass

We've embedded global_request_id into keystoneauth1 now, so the
special handling for the subclass is not needed.

Change-Id: Id45afb9130197887518a8732e046f61396308d58

commit_message:
Install additional required packages for DLRN

The DLRN documentation requires rpmdevtools to be installed for
DLRN, see [1]. While this requirement was not breaking tripleo-ci
previously, a recent commit [2] requires it.

[1] - https://github.com/softwarefactory-project/DLRN/blob/master/README.rst#setup
[2] - https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/8583

Change-Id: If97c50dc4c8f1647e183c8e12ad770d29d00b8ec

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-15 18:22:55.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/parameters.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b541f71d0f4c9fec1453342b3a89f8c02f684746', 'message': 'api-ref: fix hypervisor_hostname description for Ironic

The hypervisor_hostname shown in the os-hypervisors and servers
APIs is actually the Ironic node uuid, not a name. This comes
from the Ironic virt driver _node_resource method which eventually
gets used in the resource tracker to set the ComputeNode
hypervisor_hostname field, which is used to also set the instance.node
value in the ResourceTracker later during the instance claim.

The confusion probably lies in the fact that the variable passed
around the code is also referred to as "nodename", but in the case
of Ironic it's not actually a hostname, it's a uuid.

Change-Id: Ic639abe9989b282bad71581bb861314619c0f48b
Closes-Bug: #1698000
'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: fix hypervisor_hostname description for Ironic

The hypervisor_hostname shown in the os-hypervisors and servers
APIs is actually the Ironic node uuid, not a name. This comes
from the Ironic virt driver _node_resource method which eventually
gets used in the resource tracker to set the ComputeNode
hypervisor_hostname field, which is used to also set the instance.node
value in the ResourceTracker later during the instance claim.

The confusion probably lies in the fact that the variable passed
around the code is also referred to as "nodename", but in the case
of Ironic it's not actually a hostname, it's a uuid.

Change-Id: Ic639abe9989b282bad71581bb861314619c0f48b
Closes-Bug: #1698000
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/474723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: DVR: properly track SNAT traffic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-14 17:28:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/04ae3a9330b4cac6b6360c535dde1e525992df7a', 'message': 'DVR: properly track SNAT traffic

When running DVR, it's possible for traffic to get confused and sent
through SNAT thanks to the way conntrack tracks "new" connections.  This
patch sets "nf_connctrack_tcp_loose" inside the SNAT namespace to more
intelligently handle SNAT traffic (and ignore what should be FIP
traffic) - basically, don't track a connection where we didn't
see the initial SYN.

https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/nf_conntrack-sysctl.txt

Change-Id: Ia5b8bd3794d22808ee1718d429f0bbdbe61e94ec
Closes-Bug: 1620824
(cherry picked from commit 299d08ed3f3f170a129fb2096df73fd5af7e647d)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-15 19:43:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_snat_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_snat_ns.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/185116fd9df9b8d15b8de97c0ae89cb7be55639a', 'message': 'DVR: properly track SNAT traffic

When running DVR, it's possible for traffic to get confused and sent
through SNAT thanks to the way conntrack tracks "new" connections.  This
patch sets "nf_connctrack_tcp_loose" inside the SNAT namespace to more
intelligently handle SNAT traffic (and ignore what should be FIP
traffic) - basically, don't track a connection where we didn't
see the initial SYN.

https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/nf_conntrack-sysctl.txt

Change-Id: Ia5b8bd3794d22808ee1718d429f0bbdbe61e94ec
Closes-Bug: 1620824
(cherry picked from commit 299d08ed3f3f170a129fb2096df73fd5af7e647d)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: properly track SNAT traffic

When running DVR, it's possible for traffic to get confused and sent
through SNAT thanks to the way conntrack tracks "new" connections.  This
patch sets "nf_connctrack_tcp_loose" inside the SNAT namespace to more
intelligently handle SNAT traffic (and ignore what should be FIP
traffic) - basically, don't track a connection where we didn't
see the initial SYN.

https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/nf_conntrack-sysctl.txt

Change-Id: Ia5b8bd3794d22808ee1718d429f0bbdbe61e94ec
Closes-Bug: 1620824
(cherry picked from commit 299d08ed3f3f170a129fb2096df73fd5af7e647d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/474297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set nf_conntrack_tcp_loose to 0 to ensure mid-stream # TCP conversations aren't taken over by SNAT cmd = ['net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_tcp_loose=0'] ip_lib.sysctl(cmd, namespace=self.name)

commit_message:
Unit test framework for Ironic-UI API service

This commit is a first step in the development of a unit test framework for
the Ironic-UI API service. The approach being used is to provide an emulation
of the Ironic backend using a mock that utilizes Angular $httpbackend
handlers to intercept requests targeted at the Ironic-UI server side REST
endpoints.

In addition to demonstrating the mock I have coded some basic tests to
show how it is used. At this point I would like to get feedback from the team,
and consensus on whether we should continue the process of building
additional tests.

Change-Id: Iaec83b0e19b5051ebf1257ddc56efcc6f11ee39d

commit_message:
Make the Ironic multinode grenade job voting

The job: 'grenade-dsvm-ironic-multinode-multitenant-ubuntu-xenial' has
been a non-voting job for over a month and has been reliable.

This was discussed [1] in the Ironic weekly meeting on 19-June-2017
and was agreed to make it a voting job.

[1]
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/ironic/2017/ironic.2017-06-19-17.00.log.html#l-33

Change-Id: I576347fb8a40895f745838a05b73f3aefa86961e

commit_message:
Install etcd on all nodes

This changes etcd install to always install it regardless
of whether the SERVICE_HOST matches the HOST_IP so things
like drivers have access to the etcd packages. Without
the packages installed, things like tooz configured to use
etcd will fail to find the modules when not on the
SERVICE_HOST.

Change-Id: I27da339ec725f25a06bda7a4e5a36cf968585131
Closes-bug: #1697757

commit_message:
Use k8s 1.6 syntax of declaring affinity

K8s 1.6 has affinity/antiaffinity funtionalities as a beta feature. This
means we don't need to declare them using annotations. This commit
switches usages of affinity to 1.6 syntax.

Change-Id: Ia68f4ab28a018617bd44b1295fea58cd30eb4a39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/33/475833/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: spec: # alanmeadows: this soft requirement allows single # host deployments to spawn several mariadb containers # but in a larger environment, would attempt to spread # them out affinity: podAntiAffinity: preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution: - podAffinityTerm: labelSelector: matchExpressions: - key: app operator: In values: ["mariadb"] topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname weight: 10
deleted_lines: annotations: # alanmeadows: this soft requirement allows single # host deployments to spawn several mariadb containers # but in a larger environment, would attempt to spread # them out scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/affinity: > { "podAntiAffinity": { "preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution": [{ "labelSelector": { "matchExpressions": [{ "key": "app", "operator": "In", "values":["mariadb"] }] }, "topologyKey": "kubernetes.io/hostname", "weight": 10 }] } } spec:

commit_message:
Add consistent repositories for stable branches

Add consistent repos for promoting stable branches - ocata, newton

Change-Id: I70120b4e79149676509ec6f71d6ccc5546a4a244
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/95/475795/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: devmode: true overcloud_as_undercloud: true images: - name: overcloud-full url: "{{ overcloud_image_url }}" type: tar - name: ipa_images url: "{{ ipa_image_url }}" type: tar inject_images: - "ironic-python-agent.initramfs" - "ironic-python-agent.vmlinuz" - "ironic-python-agent.kernel" - "overcloud-full.qcow2" - "overcloud-full.initrd" - "overcloud-full.vmlinuz" release: ocata overcloud_image_url: http://66.187.229.139/builds-ocata/current-tripleo-ocata/overcloud-full.tar ipa_image_url: http://66.187.229.139/builds-ocata/current-tripleo-ocata/ipa_images.tar repo_cmd_before: | sudo yum install -y yum-plugin-priorities; sudo yum clean all; sudo rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean*; sudo rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/*.rpmsave; export CONSISTENT_RDO_MIRROR=`curl --silent https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-ocata/consistent/delorean.repo | grep baseurl | cut -d= -f2` # If running tripleo-quickstart in OpenStack Infra, let's try to use AFS mirrors if [[ -e /etc/nodepool/provider ]]; then source /etc/nodepool/provider; export NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST=$(echo "http://mirror.$NODEPOOL_REGION.$NODEPOOL_CLOUD.openstack.org" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]'); export CONSISTENT_RDO_MIRROR=${CONSISTENT_RDO_MIRROR/https:\/\/trunk.rdoproject.org/$NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST:8080/rdo} fi # Otherwise, fallback to official mirrors provided by CentOS. export NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST="${NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST:-http://mirror.centos.org}" repos: - type: generic reponame: delorean filename: delorean.repo baseurl: $CONSISTENT_RDO_MIRROR hash_url: https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-ocata/consistent/delorean.repo - type: file filename: delorean-deps.repo down_url: https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-ocata/delorean-deps.repo - type: generic reponame: centos-qemu filename: centos-qemu.repo baseurl: ${NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST}/centos/7/virt/x86_64/kvm-common/ - type: generic reponame: centos-ceph-jewel filename: centos-ceph-jewel.repo baseurl: ${NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST}/centos/7/storage/x86_64/ceph-jewel/ - type: generic reponame: centos-opstools filename: centos-opstools.repo baseurl: ${NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST}/centos/7/opstools/x86_64/ repo_cmd_after: | {% if not enable_opstools_repo|default(false)|bool %}sudo yum-config-manager --save --setopt centos-opstools.enable=0; {%endif %} sudo yum-config-manager --disable rdo-qemu-ev; sudo rpm -e epel-release || true; sudo yum remove -y rdo-release centos-release-ceph-* centos-release-openstack-* || true; sudo rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-OpenStack-*.repo /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-Ceph-*.repo /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-QEMU-EV.repo; sudo rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/*.rpmsave; sudo yum repolist; sudo yum update -y

commit_message:
Mariadb Galara Cluster remove python dependency from image

Make the MariaDB Galara Chart more independent by removing the
python dependencies from the image in favor of bash scripts.
This would allow usage of other images such as Kolla

Change-Id: Ib6752fd376fa12ac984b1091ab00048c223447aa
Implements: blueprint mariadb-remove-python

commit_message:
Use defaults in nova that better match testers and developers

When testing/developing we tend to have lightly used VMs and also
qcow2 backed images so we can default to high levels of over-commit.

Change-Id: Iab47b30f6fa0aae466fc7450f0a733e703dc8ed4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/24/467424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Create the structure and notion of environment configuration
in tripleo-quickstart.  Environmental configuration would be
defined as any configuration that does not change featureset
values or node topology.  This is for the naunces that are
required to run tripleo in different host environments whether
that be rdo-ci, tripleo-ci, ovb in a specific cloud etc.

commit_message:
formalize the notion of an environment configuration

Create the structure and notion of environment configuration
in tripleo-quickstart.  Environmental configuration would be
defined as any configuration that does not change featureset
values or node topology.  This is for the naunces that are
required to run tripleo in different host environments whether
that be rdo-ci, tripleo-ci, ovb in a specific cloud etc.

Change-Id: I4cf2e1cac0325837deeefa889a3699e0db0ec7d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/92/469992/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Default Environment : ${OPT_ENVIRONMENT:=$OPT_WORKDIR/config/environments/local_libvirt.yml} -e @OPT_ENVIRONMENT \ -e @$OPT_CONFIG \

subject: Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-16 06:47:00.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer-powervm/commit/9420ea2c507a18a819edc885969265ea1e140ca1', 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 2 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: I810f841097c64c5e73db42ca393f6179182d9694
'}]
commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 2 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: I810f841097c64c5e73db42ca393f6179182d9694
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer-powervm refs/changes/61/474861/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "-n1"] html_last_updated_fmt = subprocess.check_output(git_cmd).decode('utf-8')

commit_message:
use six.u rather than unicode for py3 compat

In Python 3 str is unicode by default and hence there is no unicode
global function. This switches our use of it to to six.u() which handles
the py2/py3 difference under the covers.

Change-Id: I3cfff2fe8e07e2a9ed8b89c93d24351b1f440b00

commit_message:
Update Spectrum Scale (GPFS) share driver doc

This patch updates the Spectrum Scale (GPFS) share driver
documentation with all the deployment modes and share creation
options.

Change-Id: I0b83ea9e508d6c660914bd2fefebe6a21046f910

commit_message:
Require the UI package when creating the virtual host

Quickstart is failing with this error:

Error: Cannot create /var/www/openstack-tripleo-ui/dist;
       parent directory /var/www/openstack-tripleo-ui does not exist
Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Ui/Apache::Vhost[tripleo-ui]/File[/var/www/openstack-tripleo-ui/dist]
       ensure: change from absent to directory
       failed: Cannot create /var/www/openstack-tripleo-ui/dist; parent directory /var/www/openstack-tripleo-ui does not exist

Puppet cant create the folders tree by itself.

Closes-bug: 1698105
Change-Id: I5cce963a6225552f4b7253cb34edc72b392b9dda

commit_message:
Checks: Update log dumps to include init containers.

This PS updates the logs dump script to include init containers
for a pod.

Change-Id: I7c3f0df62dfd5aab81bbb4e3c7193a0acda595d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/52/472852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kubectl get --namespace $NAMESPACE pod $NAME -o json | jq -r \ '.spec.initContainers[].name' | while read line; do CONTAINER=$(echo $line | awk '{print $1}') kubectl logs $NAME --namespace $NAMESPACE -c $CONTAINER > \ ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/pods/$NAMESPACE-$NAME-init-$CONTAINER.txt done

commit_message:
WIP: Rally Driven Chart Test Framework

This PS introduces 'helm test' functionality to the keystone,
glance, neutron and nova charts.

Partial-Implements: blueprint implement-helm-test-for-charts

commit_message:
Kube-State-Metrics Chart

This chart provides the ability to deploy the kube-state-metrics
agent to produce cluster level metrics for prometheus to consume.
It should be used as part of an end-to-end cluster monitoring
solution

Change-Id: I5ca75f66d602237bff4444af6f24a4787042be9c

commit_message:
Grafana Helm Chart

This adds a Grafana helm chart to be used in conjunction with
prometheus. It includes dashboards for a number of prometheus
data exporters, and can be modified as necessary.

Change-Id: Idb7ff3ae92f544bcc04da2b95920a3aaa4333aed

commit_message:
node-exporter Chart

This chart allows for the deployment of a daemonset for the
prometheus node-exporter. It can be used to export metrics for
hardware and operating systems exposed by the kernel. The chart
is provided to be used as part of an end-to-end monitoring
solution for openstack-helm

Change-Id: Ibe435c13bee31a49122c159bdaf335ed00696e5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-addons refs/changes/61/471461/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 The Openstack-Helm Authors. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # Default values for node-exporter. # This is a YAML-formatted file. # Declare variables to be passed into your templates. apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1 kind: DaemonSet metadata: name: node-exporter spec: template: metadata: labels: app: node-exporter name: node-exporter spec: hostNetwork: true hostPID: true containers: - image: {{ .Values.images.node_exporter }} imagePullPolicy: {{ .Values.images.pull_policy }} args: - "-collector.procfs=/host/proc" - "-collector.sysfs=/host/sys" name: node-exporter ports: - containerPort: {{ .Values.network.port.port }} hostPort: {{ .Values.network.port.port }} name: scrape {{ if .Values.resources.enabled }} resources: requests: memory: {{ .Values.resources.requests.memory }} cpu: {{ .Values.resources.requests.cpu}} limits: memory: {{ .Values.resources.limits.memory }} cpu: {{ .Values.resources.limits.cpu }} {{ end }} volumeMounts: - name: proc readOnly: true mountPath: /host/proc - name: sys readOnly: true mountPath: /host/sys volumes: - name: proc hostPath: path: /proc - name: sys hostPath: path: /sys

commit_message:
Use distro specific netcat package names

Update the memcached-flush upgrade playbook with the correct distro
specific name of the netcat package and fix a typo in the
'ansible_os_family' variable name.

Change-Id: I140bcf45ca4c7b338b2fec69188a80d4226fb2cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/76/475476/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: netcat_package: debian: "netcat-openbsd" redhat: "nmap-ncat" tasks: - name: Ensuring netcat is installed package: name: "{{ netcat_package.get(ansible_os_family | lower) }}" echo 'flush_all' | nc $(awk '/^\-l/ {print $2}' {{ memcached_conf_dest.get(ansible_os_family | lower) }} | awk -F, '{ print $1 }') $(awk '/^\-p/ {print $2}' {{ memcached_conf_dest.get(ansible_os_family | lower) }} )
deleted_lines: tasks: - name: Ensuring nc is installed package: name: nc echo 'flush_all' | nc $(awk '/^\-l/ {print $2}' {{ memcached_conf_dest.get(ansible_os_family | lower) }} | awk -F, '{ print $1 }') $(awk '/^\-p/ {print $2}' {{ memcached_conf_dest.get(ansible_family | lower) }} )

commit_message:
WIP: OpenStack-API Ingress Controller Pattern

This PS introduces a pattern for ingress to OpenStack public API
endpoints.

Change-Id: I6323e66ea98d15c52b07c8e737fdd6f30aef0238
'}]
commit_message:
Restore previous IP binding

This commit 6fdf4e1086c53adf47561697cf82417e1f3b14ed have changed
the default binded ip, it binds one random interface on the system
instead of all. Break breaks all gate that expect the default to at
least listen on localhost.

This change restore the previous default.

Change-Id: I6323e66ea98d15c52b07c8e737fdd6f30aef0238

deleted_lines: usage='%%(prog)s [-h] [--port PORT] [--host IP] -- [passed options]') parser.add_argument('--host', '-b', default=my_ip, help='IP to bind the server to') server = wss.make_server(args.host, args.port, %(invoke_target)s()) url = "http://%%s:%%d/" %% (server.server_name, server.server_port)

commit_message:
Add reload support to init file

All services except the API service support
the use of SIGHUP to reload config files
without shutting down network sockets (and
perhaps other things).

This patch adds support for reloading the
services instead of just restarting it to
assist with improving rolling upgrades.

Change-Id: Id95cae40f736ea2c84200955fccdb44ea3bc1dd8

subject: Make werkzeug log the client IP when using proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 16:44:14.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/cmd/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/5dde59dcd4638f38ce178ac1a0ebf828be72a65c', 'message': "Make werkzeug log the client IP when using proxy

By default werkzeug is taking the REMOTE_ADDR as the client IP, which
gives the proxy IP when using a reverse proxy. Check for the
X-Forwarded-For header and also log that IP when it's available.

Werkzeug has a ProxyIP fixer which does something similar changing the
REMOTE_ADDR env var, but this is not used for logging.

Change-Id: Ib61bd9ac6767f67f06c7e7a3158be959f9a898d3
Closes-Bug: #1666943
"}]
commit_message:
Make werkzeug log the client IP when using proxy

By default werkzeug is taking the REMOTE_ADDR as the client IP, which
gives the proxy IP when using a reverse proxy. Check for the
X-Forwarded-For header and also log that IP when it's available.

Werkzeug has a ProxyIP fixer which does something similar changing the
REMOTE_ADDR env var, but this is not used for logging.

Change-Id: Ib61bd9ac6767f67f06c7e7a3158be959f9a898d3
Closes-Bug: #1666943
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/31/437031/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Workaround to log the actual client IP when using a reverse proxy. # This is only used when the corresponding header is present. # werkzeug doesn't seem to do it even when using ProxyFix, so we're # left with this hack. _handler_clazz = serving.WSGIRequestHandler _handler_clazz.address_string = \ type(_handler_clazz.address_string)( lambda self: ('%s,%s' % ( self.headers.dict['x-forwarded-for'], self.client_address[0]) if 'x-forwarded-for' in self.headers.dict else self.client_address[0] ), None, _handler_clazz)

subject: Implement data migrations for rolling upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-02 19:17:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder/commit/dffed85a20eaa6c671441229d4f492b3d35c2a4e', 'message': "Implement data migrations for rolling upgrades

In order to cater for artifact-based installed, and
rolling upgrades, this patch implements a set of local
facts to inform the db sync and online migrations
tasks.

The 'cinder_all_software_updated' variables will be
set by the playbook on each run to ensure that the
online migrations only happen once all venvs are
homogenous. This ensures that the playbook can be
executed in a serialised fashion and the data will
not be corrupted.

Change-Id: I9aacda78f92355374af3f4ab24d2d9a9b47491ed

commit_message:
Implement data migrations for rolling upgrades

In order to cater for artifact-based installed, and
rolling upgrades, this patch implements a set of local
facts to inform the db sync and online migrations
tasks.

The 'cinder_all_software_updated' variables will be
set by the playbook on each run to ensure that the
online migrations only happen once all venvs are
homogenous. This ensures that the playbook can be
executed in a serialised fashion and the data will
not be corrupted.

Change-Id: I9aacda78f92355374af3f4ab24d2d9a9b47491ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/08/470408/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Record the need for a db sync ini_file: dest: "/etc/ansible/facts.d/openstack_ansible.fact" section: cinder option: need_db_sync value: True when: cinder_get_venv | changed or cinder_venv_dir | changed or install_packages | changed

subject: Implement rolling upgrades for cinder

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-01 17:40:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/f1bd17cd37b75e086c1707a7cd5539417d1f4ced', 'message': '[WIP] Implement rolling upgrades for cinder

Based on [1], this patch implements changes to the playbook
which executes the cinder deployment in a play per host
group, serialised to ensure that:

1. The services are changed in the right order.
2. The services remain available at all times during
   an upgrade.

TODO:
 - Implement the load balancer bits to ensure that the
   endpoints are set into maintenance mode before changes
   are implemented, then enabled again afterwards.
 - Implement changes to the os_cinder role to ensure that
   the handlers are appropriately filtered.
 - Implement changes to the os_cinder role to ensure that
   any conditionals no longer have warnings about jinja use.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/cinder/upgrade.html#minimal-downtime-upgrade-procedure

Change-Id: I0bdb51ce0d8b3b9a145d29ef6808e1fe595924e2

'}, {'number': 23, 'created': '2017-06-12 18:47:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/06d31c8f3c84d51dad60375d00a25da63923b478', 'message': 'Implement rolling upgrades for cinder

Based on [1], this patch implements changes to the playbook
which executes the cinder deployment in a play per host
group, serialised to ensure that:

1. The services are changed in the right order.
2. The services remain available at all times during
   an upgrade.

   of software are at the same levels.

   role execution will not execute twice on the same
   host.

Based on [1], this patch implements changes to the playbook
which executes the cinder deployment in a play per host
group, serialised to ensure that:

1. The services are changed in the right order.
2. The services remain available at all times during
   an upgrade.
3. Online data migrations are actioned once all versions
   of software are at the same levels.
4. If services are sharing a host/container then the

commit_message:
Implement rolling upgrades for cinder

Based on [1], this patch implements changes to the playbook
which executes the cinder deployment in a play per host
group, serialised to ensure that:

1. The services are changed in the right order.
2. The services remain available at all times during
   an upgrade.
3. Online data migrations are actioned once all versions
   of software are at the same levels.
4. If services are sharing a host/container then the
   role execution will not execute twice on the same
   host.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/cinder/upgrade.html#minimal-downtime-upgrade-procedure

Depends-On: Id95cae40f736ea2c84200955fccdb44ea3bc1dd8

added_lines: .. Copyright 2017 EasyStack, Inc. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. .. _add_new_resource_types: ==================== New Resource Types ==================== Ceilometer makes it availble to create new resource types or update attributes of a resource-type from other external components for Gnocchi. Before starting doing that, this guide is the one that you need follow. .. _resource_types: Either add/remove attributes of a resource-type or create a new resource-type is allowed. Whichever operation you choose, the first section must be changed is `resources_update_operations`_. .. _resources_update_operations: https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/gnocchi_client.py#L104 There are three update operation examples. 1. Add `flavor_name` attribute to `instance` resource: {"desc": "add flavor_name to instance", "type": "update_attribute_type", "resource_type": "instance", "data": [{ "op": "add", "path": "/attributes/flavor_name", "value": {"type": "string", "min_length": 0, "max_length": 255, "required": True, "options": {'fill': ''}} }]} 2. Remove `server_group` attribute to `instance` resource: {"desc": "remove server_group to instance", "type": "update_attribute_type", "resource_type": "instance", "data": [{ "op": "add", "path": "/attributes/server_group", "value": {"type": "string", "min_length": 0, "max_length": 255, "required": False, "options": {'fill': ''}} }]} 3. Create a new resource type named `nova_compute`: {"desc": "add nova_compute resource type", "type": "create_resource_type", "resource_type": "nova_compute", "data": [{ "attributes": {"host_name": {"type": "string", "min_length": 0, "max_length": 255, "required": True}} }]} Then Add `upgrade_resource_types`_ process responding to the operation you add above. Every process is a api request to Gnocchi service. Gnocchi will implement every update operation on upgrade. .. _upgrade_resource_types: https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/gnocchi_client.py#L133 With accomplishing sections above, don't forget to add a new resource type or attributes of a resource type into :the file:`ceilometer/dispatcher/data/gnocchi_resources.yaml`.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-14 03:12:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/3e58682d00de0c82df2ab1b91255524702148735', 'message': "Don't install tempest globally

Devstack installs tempest into a virtualenv with tox when you enable the
tempest service. Because some devs apparently found this confusing it
also installs tempest globally by default.

This global install is redundant and itself makes the jobs longer but
the extra globaly pacakges affect OSC runtime due to pkg_resources

"}]
commit_message:
Don't install tempest globally

Devstack installs tempest into a virtualenv with tox when you enable the
tempest service. Because some devs apparently found this confusing it
also installs tempest globally by default.

This global install is redundant and itself makes the jobs longer but
the extra globaly pacakges affect OSC runtime due to pkg_resources
entrypoint iteration. Just remove it since it is unneeded and safe the
time needed to install tempest and iterate its installation on disk.

Change-Id: Ie4375fa82aa745f961e57bee306b695923617b90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/36/474036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When you enable the tempest service that creates a virtualenv for # tempest. This virtualenv is what we run tests out of. Additionally # devstack installs tempest globally by default. We dont need that # and since the installation process adds to devstack-gate runtime # due to the extra steps and extra packages affecting OSC just don't # install it globally. localrc_set "$localrc_file" "INSTALL_TEMPEST" "False"

commit_message:
rework etcd3 install to be like other devstack services

This separates out the install phase early from the start phase to
make this mirror other services in devstack.

Depends-On: I4124dc7e3fd3b4d973979da85209ec991c0f8c4b

Change-Id: I76f8740448b25a48869ee80006e826baa6cafc2b

commit_message:
remove etcd3 from subnode install

The stops installing etcd3 on the subnodes. In
I76f8740448b25a48869ee80006e826baa6cafc2b we make etcd3 mean that
the etcd3 server (and always install the etcd3 client).

Change-Id: I4124dc7e3fd3b4d973979da85209ec991c0f8c4b

commit_message:
Add FloatingIPList.get_count_by_project()

This adds a method to get a count of floating ips for checking quota.
Note that floating ip quota is only relevant to nova-network and will
be obsolete when nova-network is removed.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: Iaa6df1e32c8bb1b94b6d1abad8beec1c7eb6cac2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/446247/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_count_by_project(self): ips = [objects.FloatingIPList.make_ip_info('1.1.1.1', 'pool', 'eth0')] objects.FloatingIPList.create(self.context, ips) floating_ip.FloatingIP.allocate_address(self.context, self.context.project_id, 'pool') self.assertEqual(1, floating_ip.FloatingIPList.get_count_by_project( self.context, self.context.project_id))

subject: Count fixed ips to check quota

commit_message:
Count fixed ips to check quota

This changes fixed ips from a ReservableResource to a
CountableResource and replaces quota reserve/commit/rollback with
check_deltas accordingly. Note that fixed ip quota is only relevant to
nova-network and will be obsolete when nova-network is removed.

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: Ia9e8142435888f6bc600e40bc7b0bf24b19576fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/61/457861/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('nova.objects.quotas.Quotas.count') @mock.patch('nova.objects.quotas.Quotas.limit_check_project_and_user') def test_allocate_calculates_quota_auth(self, util_method, check, count, check.side_effect = exception.OverQuota(overs='testing', quotas={'fixed_ips': 10}, usages={})
deleted_lines: @mock.patch('nova.objects.quotas.Quotas.reserve') def test_allocate_calculates_quota_auth(self, util_method, reserve, usages = {'fixed_ips': {'in_use': 10, 'reserved': 1}} reserve.side_effect = exception.OverQuota(overs='testing', quotas={'fixed_ips': 10}, usages=usages) @mock.patch('nova.objects.fixed_ip.FixedIP.get_by_address') @mock.patch('nova.objects.quotas.Quotas.reserve') @mock.patch('nova.objects.quotas.ids_from_instance') def test_deallocate_calculates_quota_auth(self, util_method, reserve, get_by_address): inst = objects.Instance(uuid=uuids.instance) fip = objects.FixedIP(instance_uuid=uuids.instance, virtual_interface_id=1) get_by_address.return_value = fip util_method.return_value = ('foo', 'bar') # This will fail right after the reserve call when it tries # to look up the fake instance we created above self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceNotFound, self.network.deallocate_fixed_ip, self.context, '1.2.3.4', instance=inst) util_method.assert_called_once_with(self.context, inst) @mock.patch('nova.objects.quotas.Quotas.rollback') @mock.patch('nova.objects.fixed_ip.FixedIP.get_by_address') @mock.patch('nova.network.manager.NetworkManager.' '_do_trigger_security_group_members_refresh_for_instance') def test_fixed_ip_cleanup_rollback(self, fake_trig, fixed_get, rollback): manager = network_manager.NetworkManager() fake_trig.side_effect = test.TestingException self.assertRaises(test.TestingException, manager.deallocate_fixed_ip, self.context, 'fake', 'fake', instance=fake_inst(uuid=uuids.non_existent_uuid)) rollback.assert_called_once_with()

commit_message:
Add FixedIPList.get_count_by_project()

This adds a method to get a count of fixed ips in the database for
checking quota. Note that fixed ip quota is only relevant to
nova-network and will be obsolete when nova-network is removed.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: Ia781d9785165e71d7b90657b1931f29d988d4956
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/446246/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.db.sqlalchemy import api as db_api from nova.db.sqlalchemy import models # Version 1.15: Added get_count_by_project() for quotas VERSION = '1.15' @staticmethod @db_api.pick_context_manager_reader def _get_count_by_project_from_db(context, project_id): return context.session.query(models.FixedIp.id).\ filter_by(deleted=0).\ join(models.Instance, models.Instance.uuid == models.FixedIp.instance_uuid).\ filter(models.Instance.project_id == project_id).\ count() @obj_base.remotable_classmethod def get_count_by_project(cls, context, project_id): return cls._get_count_by_project_from_db(context, project_id)

commit_message:
Count security groups to check quota

This changes security groups from a ReservableResource to a
CountableResource and replaces quota reserve/commit/rollback with
check_deltas accordingly. Note that security group quota is only
relevant to nova-network and will be obsolete when nova-network
is removed.

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: I51b74b863fafd14ef31b1abd9fd9820deb622aeb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/457860/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: objects.Quotas.check_deltas(context, 'security_groups', {'security_groups': 1}, context.project_id, user_id=context.user_id) self.ensure_default(context) group = {'user_id': context.user_id, 'project_id': context.project_id, 'name': name, 'description': description} try: group_ref = self.db.security_group_create(context, group) except exception.SecurityGroupExists: msg = _('Security group %s already exists') % name self.raise_group_already_exists(msg) # NOTE(melwitt): We recheck the quota after creating the # object to handle races. Delete the object if we're over # quota after creating the object. try: objects.Quotas.check_deltas(context, 'security_groups', {'security_groups': 0}, context.project_id, user_id=context.user_id) except exception.OverQuota: self.db.security_group_destroy(context, group_ref['id']) msg = _("Quota exceeded, too many security groups.") self.raise_over_quota(msg)
deleted_lines: quotas = objects.Quotas(context=context) try: quotas.reserve(security_groups=1) try: self.ensure_default(context) group = {'user_id': context.user_id, 'project_id': context.project_id, 'name': name, 'description': description} try: group_ref = self.db.security_group_create(context, group) except exception.SecurityGroupExists: msg = _('Security group %s already exists') % name self.raise_group_already_exists(msg) # Commit the reservation quotas.commit() except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): quotas.rollback() quotas = objects.Quotas(context=context) quota_project, quota_user = quotas_obj.ids_from_security_group( context, security_group) try: quotas.reserve(project_id=quota_project, user_id=quota_user, security_groups=-1) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to update usages deallocating " "security group")) # Commit the reservations quotas.commit()

commit_message:
Add SecurityGroupList.get_counts()

This adds a method for getting counts of security groups in the
database for checking quota. Note that security group quota is only
relevant to nova-network and will be obsolete when nova-network is
removed.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: I3d41be47914991da366d35de5b1a41178065439e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/446245/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.db.sqlalchemy import api as db_api from nova.db.sqlalchemy import models # Version 1.1: Added get_counts() for quotas VERSION = '1.1' @staticmethod @db_api.pick_context_manager_reader def _get_counts_from_db(context, project_id, user_id=None): query = context.session.query(models.SecurityGroup.id).\ filter_by(deleted=0).\ filter_by(project_id=project_id) counts = {} counts['project'] = {'security_groups': query.count()} if user_id: query = query.filter_by(user_id=user_id) counts['user'] = {'security_groups': query.count()} return counts @base.remotable_classmethod def get_counts(cls, context, project_id, user_id=None): """Get the counts of InstanceGroup objects in the database. :param context: The request context for database access :param project_id: The project_id to count across :param user_id: The user_id to count across :returns: A dict containing the project-scoped counts and user-scoped counts if user_id is specified. For example: {'project': {'security_groups': <count across project>}, 'user': {'security_groups': <count across user>}} """ return cls._get_counts_from_db(context, project_id, user_id=user_id)

commit_message:
Count networks to check quota

This changes networks from a ReservableResource to a CountableResource
and replaces quota reserve/commit/rollback with check_deltas
accordingly. Note that network quota is only relevant to nova-network
and will be obsolete when nova-network is removed.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: If2e279728be056566829ae58d45d31801cd59b6c

added_lines: from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.RegisterNetworkQuota()) delete_mock, disassociate_mock): def test_network_delete(self, disassociate_mock, delete_mock): @mock.patch('nova.objects.Quotas.count') @mock.patch('nova.objects.Quotas.limit_check') def test_network_create(self, create_mock, check_mock, count_mock): # First count is before the network is created, second is after. count_mock.side_effect = [1, 2] call = mock.call(ctxt, 'networks', ctxt.project_id) # Called twice because of recheck quota for races. self.assertEqual(2, count_mock.call_count) count_mock.assert_has_calls([call, call]) self.assertEqual(2, check_mock.call_count) call = mock.call(ctxt, networks=2) check_mock.assert_has_calls([call, call]) @mock.patch('nova.objects.Quotas.count') @mock.patch('nova.objects.Quotas.limit_check') def test_network_create_quota_error(self, check_mock, count_mock): count_mock.return_value = 1 check_mock.side_effect = exception.OverQuota(overs='fake') count_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, 'networks', ctxt.project_id) check_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, networks=2) @mock.patch('nova.objects.Quotas.count') @mock.patch('nova.objects.Quotas.limit_check') check_mock, count_mock): count_mock.return_value = 1 count_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, 'networks', ctxt.project_id) check_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, networks=2)
deleted_lines: @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.reserve') @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.rollback') delete_mock, disassociate_mock, rollback_mock, reserve_mock): reserve_mock.return_value = 'rv' rollback_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, 'rv') reserve_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, networks=-1) @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.reserve') @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.commit') def test_network_delete(self, disassociate_mock, delete_mock, commit_mock, reserve_mock): reserve_mock.return_value = 'rv' commit_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, 'rv') reserve_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, networks=-1) @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.reserve') @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.commit') def test_network_create(self, create_mock, commit_mock, reserve_mock): reserve_mock.return_value = 'rv' commit_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, 'rv') reserve_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, networks=1) @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.reserve') def test_network_create_quota_error(self, reserve_mock): reserve_mock.side_effect = exception.OverQuota(overs='fake') reserve_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, networks=1) @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.reserve') @mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.rollback') rollback_mock, reserve_mock): reserve_mock.return_value = 'rv' reserve_mock.assert_called_once_with(ctxt, networks=1)

commit_message:
Added support for horizon_launch_instance_defaults

This variable allows customizing the default values for properties found
in the Launch Instance modal, using the LAUNCH_INSTANCE_DEFAULTS config
option.

Change-Id: I1a795b788b3fbc78e814c93f56fd996090c7463b

commit_message:
fix Rally task [NovaServers.list_servers] failed with network problems

when we get 'nics' information from rally task config
'contexts', the type of self.config["nics"] is 'tuple', but we need it is 'list'
type.

Change-Id: If293700a5c0a2f30a23b1fcf808adb6e467c76c6
Closes-Bug: #1695245
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/66/475766/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kwargs["nics"] = list(self.config["nics"])
